commit.message: Use a default persona name when one isn't specified.

- Added more tests to the functional test - creating cases and datasources, and account_instance attributes so that Persona could be traced back to a case/data source.
- Fixed an issue with tests failing because Central Repo cache was not being cleared between tests, even though the underlying database itself was being recreated.
- Fixed a bug in the Persona query.

Added APIS to:
 - get all Persona in a Case/dataSource.
 - get all cases/data sources for a persona.

Added additional test cases.

Addressed review comments:
 - Moved d/b queries to corresponding suitable datamodel classes.
 - Dissolved and deleted PersonaHelper class.

Added APIS to query persona by:
 - persona name substring
 - account identifier substring.
Defined a new class, CentralRepoExaminer, to disambiguate from the Examiner class in case database.

- Removed pre-population of the examiner table.
- Replaced getCurrentExaminer() method with getOrInsertExaminer()

nodes.bodyText: There is a mismatch between making this interface public while the methods on CentralRepository that user it are package-private.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@

+package org.sleuthkit.autopsy.centralrepository.datamodel;
+
+import java.sql.ResultSet;
+import java.sql.SQLException;
+
+/**
+ * An interface to process the resultset from a Central Repository DB query.
+ * This enables clients of Central Repository to run custom queries and process
+ * the results themselves.
+ *
+ */
+public interface CentralRepositoryDbQueryCallback {

@@ -159,6 +161,23 @@ static boolean isEnabled() {
      * @param eamCase The case to update
      */
     void updateCase(CorrelationCase eamCase) throws CentralRepoException;
+    
+    /**
+     * Updates the examiners table, by adding current logged in user to
+     * examiners table, if not already in there.
+     * 
+     * @throws CentralRepoException If there is an error.
+     *
+     */
+    void updateExaminers() throws CentralRepoException;

nodes.bodyText: The only place this method, which exposes implementation details, appears to be called outside of the implementations of this interface is in test code where it is called on a newly created database that should have empty caches. Do we need to expose this method as part of this interface?

What is the intended use of this string? This seems to force the UI to check for "NoName" and either put empty text in the UI or swap in something more human readable. From a data modeling perspective, NULL seems more standard and it makes sense in terms of separation of the data layer from the presentation layer to allow the UI decide how to display NULL optional data.

I don't believe we have any way of populating this displayName field in the database or this class at this time. It is not in the ERD. What is the use case envisioned for it? I think we can leave the table column alone since it already exists in the last release, but we can ignore it in this class.

nodes.bodyText: I don't think we need this since we have getPersonaAccounts.

commit.message:
- Deleted unused method updateExaminers()
- Added escaping of examiner name
- Added a unit test for getOrInsertExaminer() method.
